message.content:
<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: 
JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++) {
    JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
    Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
    while (keys.hasNext()) {
        String key = keys.next();
        JSONArray values = jsonObject.getJSONArray(key);
        String name = key;
        String value = values.getString(0);
        String stock = values.getString(1);
        // Create Fruit object and set the values
        Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
        fruit.setName(name);
        fruit.setValue(value);
        fruit.setStock(stock);
        // Do something with the fruit object
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: First, create a JSONArray from the string received in the request parameter. Then, iterate through the JSONArray and for each JSONObject, get the keys using the iterator. Get the JSONArray of values for each key and extract the name, value, and stock from the JSONArray. Finally, create a Fruit object and set the values accordingly.

<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for(int i=0; i<jsonArray.length(); i++){
  JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
  Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
  while(keys.hasNext()){
    String key = keys.next();
    JSONArray values = jsonObject.getJSONArray(key);
    String name = key;
    String value = values.getString(0);
    String stock = values.getString(1);
    Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
    fruit.setName(name);
    fruit.setValue(value);
    fruit.setStock(stock);
    // do something with the fruit object
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: You can use the JSONArray and JSONObject classes to parse the JSON string. Iterate through the JSONArray and get each JSONObject. Get the keys of each JSONObject and retrieve the values using the key. Create a new Fruit object and set the values accordingly.

<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for(int i=0; i<jsonArray.length(); i++){
  JSONObject object = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
  Iterator<String> keys = object.keys();
  while(keys.hasNext()){
    String key = keys.next();
    JSONArray values = object.getJSONArray(key);
    String name = key;
    String value = values.getString(0);
    String stock = values.getString(1);
    // create Fruit object and set values
    Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
    fruit.setName(name);
    fruit.setValue(value);
    fruit.setStock(stock);
    // do something with fruit object
  }
}
<<<explanation>>>: First, create a JSONArray object from the string obtained from the request parameter. Then, iterate through the JSONArray using a for loop. For each JSONObject in the JSONArray, get the keys using the keys() method. Iterate through the keys using a while loop. Get the JSONArray values for each key and extract the name, value, and stock values. Create a Fruit object and set the values accordingly. Finally, you can perform any desired operations with the Fruit object.

<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for (int i = 0; i < jsonArray.length(); i++) {
    JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
    Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
    while (keys.hasNext()) {
        String key = keys.next();
        JSONArray values = jsonObject.getJSONArray(key);
        String setName = key;
        String setValue = values.getString(0);
        String setStock = values.getString(1);
        // Create Fruit object and set the values
        Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
        fruit.setName(setName);
        fruit.setValue(setValue);
        fruit.setStock(setStock);
        // Do something with the fruit object
    }
}
<<<explanation>>>: First, parse the string into a JSONArray. Then, iterate through the JSONArray and for each JSONObject, get the keys and values. Set the values to the Fruit object accordingly.

Inside the loop, get the JSONObject at each index using jsonArray.getJSONObject(i). Get the keys of the JSON object using obj.keys() and iterate through them using a while loop. Inside the while loop, get the JSONArray of values for each key using obj.getJSONArray(key). Extract the name, value, and stock from the JSONArray and create a Fruit object. Set the values of the Fruit object using the setter methods. Finally, you can perform any actions with the Fruit object as needed.

<<<explanation>>>: First, you need to create a JSONArray object from the string obtained from request.getParameter(). Then, you can iterate through the JSONArray using a for loop. Inside the loop, you can get each JSONObject using jsonArray.getJSONObject(i). Then, you can get the keys of the JSONObject using jsonObject.keys() and iterate through them using a while loop. For each key, you can get the corresponding JSONArray using jsonObject.getJSONArray(key) and get the values from the array using values.getString(index). Finally, you can create a new Fruit object, set its properties, and perform any desired actions with the Fruit object.

<<<api>>>: JSONArray, JSONObject
<<<code>>>: JSONArray jsonArray = new JSONArray(str);
for(int i=0; i<jsonArray.length(); i++) {
   JSONObject jsonObject = jsonArray.getJSONObject(i);
   Iterator<String> keys = jsonObject.keys();
   while(keys.hasNext()) {
      String key = keys.next();
      JSONArray values = jsonObject.getJSONArray(key);
      String name = key;
      String value = values.getString(0);
      String stock = values.getString(1);
      
      Fruit fruit = new Fruit();
      fruit.setName(name);
      fruit.setValue(value);
      fruit.setStock(stock);
      
      // Do something with the fruit object
   }
}
<<<explanation>>>: First, you need to create a JSONArray object from the string parameter. Then, iterate through the JSONArray using a for loop. Inside the loop, get the JSONObject at each index. Use the keys() method to get an iterator of the keys in the JSONObject. Iterate through the keys using a while loop. Get the JSONArray associated with each key using the getJSONArray() method. Extract the name, value, and stock from the JSONArray. Create a new Fruit object and set its properties using the extracted values. Finally, you can do something with the fruit object as needed.
